column106: Pretty pricy, it's very hard to find new tv shows/movies (other than very popular ones or ones that are similar to already seen ones), viewing activity is not simple to find (or to delete, for example when I accidentally start a film that I don't want to see or if I change my mind about a tv show), it's not possible to download movies on a computer (only on mobile devices). The homepage is a bit crowded
column107: Huge catalogue, option to share an account with friends (to lower the price per month), possibility to save shows. information about a movie is easy to find and read. Below any film, there are similar ones listed. Very easy to switch from one language to another (both with audio and subtitles), and to switch from one episode to another one.

column139:
Tv shows' seasons are separated from each other on the homepage (different from Netflix or Disney+ for example). Many movies/tv-shows are not accessible with the standard monthly payment, but they need to be paid for individually.
If you want to change the episode you can just skip to the next one.

column153: if I cannot find content on a platform I already have access to I just pirate it. I will not purchase a new streaming service if I lose access, I will just pirate more. I've never had this issue specifically with Netflix or Amazon Prime Video, but sometimes content is difficult to access on a streaming platform I have legal access to, but I still pirate it because it is hard to use the platform. Examples in the past include HBO (because it was bundled with Xfinity and I couldn't figure out how to access my HBO credentials via Xfinity's portal) and Disney Plus (because their video player is extremely buggy and unresponsive on many of my devices, particuarly for someone who likes to re-wind a lot and pause a lot).
